metadata.title: CVE-2022-42328 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Guests can trigger deadlock in Linux netback driver T[his CNA informationrecord relates to multiple CVEs; the text explains whichaspects/vulnerabilities correspond to which CVE.] The patch for XSA-392introduced another issue which might result in a deadlock when trying tofree the SKB of a packet dropped due to the XSA-392 handling(CVE-2022-42328). Additionally when dropping packages for other reasons thesame deadlock could occur in case of netpoll being active for the interfacethe xen-netback driver is connected to (CVE-2022-42329).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42328` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required
